meanings.definition: The quality of being stubborn or difficult to deal with.
meanings.sent1: Her cussednesses made it challenging to convince her to try new things.
meanings.sent2: Dealing with his cussednesses at work was always a test of patience.
meanings.sent3: Despite his cussednesses, we couldn't help but admire his determination.
meanings.sent4: The cussednesses of the old tree roots refused to budge from the ground.
meanings.sent5: The cussednesses of the rusty lock kept the treasure hidden away.

meanings.definition: An act of being stubborn or difficult to deal with.
meanings.sent1: His cussednesses in refusing to compromise led to a stalemate.
meanings.sent2: After her cussednesses during the negotiation, progress was hard to achieve.
meanings.sent3: The cussednesses of the cat in chasing its tail provided endless entertainment.
meanings.sent4: The cussednesses of the storm delayed our plans for the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The cussednesses of the traffic lights seemed to conspire against us that day.
